intro: Amaranthus grandiflorus, commonly known as the showy amaranth, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plant produces small, three-lobed leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its seeds are small and often used as a grain or for ornamental purposes. Amaranthus grandiflorus is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
